nodes.text: Paying a small sum of money to an official to speed up a process is known as a facilitation payment. We make no distinction between facilitation payments and bribes, no matter how small the amount. Facilitation payments are illegal in most countries in which we operate and UK law forbids them anywhere in the world.
It is unlikely to be a facilitation payment if it is an official, fixed and published fee and you will get a receipt.

However, there are legitimate fees for speeding up some services such as a fee to quickly process an application. Make the payment if it is an official transaction and it has been asked for in an open and transparent way.
Obtain a receipt detailing the reason for and the amount of the charge.
Record the transaction appropriately.
If you are in any doubt do not pay.
